description:
Ding Lei (Chinese: 丁磊; pinyin: Dīng Lěi; born October 1, 1971), also known as William Ding, is a Chinese billionaire businessman, and the founder and CEO of NetEase (163.com).
Ding made significant contributions to the development of computer networks in mainland China. In late 2016, Ding was looking into investing in the property sector and travelled to Zimbabwe in December and to the United Kingdom. As of April 2021, the Bloomberg Billionaires Index estimated Ding's fortune to be $35.8 billion.
